intro: Decaspermum coriandri, commonly known as wild cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy aroma similar to cumin. The seeds are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
